comment: She will always listen and take care of your concerns for the class. Personally, I did not have any sort of trouble with her! She is clear with her grading scales and expects the syllabus criteria to be met. Nothing wrong with that, but there is not much leniency in missed labs, tests, or group projects. She is an honest and caring professor.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: I thought she was an ok professor, but was not clear when it came to the due date of the very last assignment we had to turn in. Brought my grade down to an 89.93%, which she would not round to an A, and I lost my 4.0 GPA. Group project where you could be stuck with people who do not participate, but you will suffer for it. Choose someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects

comment: Professor Vogelien was amazing for Genetics Lab! She explained the labs in detail and gave you step-by-step guides on how to write the lab notebook. She was always fair and made it easy to get an A in the class if you go to lab and complete the pre-lab and post-lab quizzes. I would definitely take her again!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Very hard to follow in class. Exams/quizzes are purposely made to be overly complex and confusing. A LOT of material that requires a LOT of studying. I took her for lab as well and I see a lot of people saying she's nice but when someone pointed out that she taught us something incorrectly she scolded them and yelled at the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Don't listen to all the positive reviews on here. She is a really nice and caring person, but is not the best at actually teaching the material. Her tests and quizzes have very low class averages, and the only way to pass is to read the textbook front to back. If you care about your grade take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She was okay at teaching. Her exams are difficult compared to other professors. She just kinda gives you A LOT of material in class and expects you to know it for the exams. You really need to eat and breath genetics to do good in this class. I did learn a lot in this class though. She's also super nice and seems happy all the time.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Took her lab, she explains things well and the grading criteria is really clear, but you only get one skip a semester and it must be excused. Fairly easy if you use the resources she provides.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects

comment: She's a very nice person but I only took her based on the ratings here but honestly she's hard to follow in class she gets off on other subjects and won't fully explain how to do anything. She'll talk about things but won't show you how to do them esp for more advanced questions. Doing extra study with her is the only way she'll work out a problem.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Grades on quizzes, homework, and 4 tests. non cumulative final. Gives detailed feedback after each test and quiz. Very kind and says her goal is for everyone to succeed. Pay attention in lectures and take detailed notes. Very easy class with a lot of potential grade padding. Ask questions after class or in office hours. She is very approachable
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Class is already difficult enough- she makes it even tougher with her impossible quizzes and exams. No dropped exams but can makeup one. I believe she only has good ratings because she is nice; however, she is a very tough grader.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I don't understand how her ratings are so high. She is a really nice person but her exams are so tough. She does NOT prepare you for her exams!! She only counts 7 quizzes from 12 in total but even those quizzes set you up for failure. If you take her, be ready to study at least 2-3 hours a day. Please take someone else if you care about your GPA.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She's great in the lab and wants to help students succeed. Notebooks are done in lab so that takes a lot of time and she grades them but she isn't a tough grader. Pre and post quizzes are on D2L and they are pretty easy. She is very helpful inside and outside of lab. She does provide resources that help with filling out your notebook for each lab.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Quizzes were very helpful for exams. PowerPoints were very helpful. Weekly mastering homework. 3 exams & a NON-CUMULATIVE final, so 4 exams total. Big on masks.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: The best! Lectures were streamlined you can tell shes been doing this for a minute & still cares deeply. This class will make you love being a science major, its so interesting. HW-pearson mastering, 12 quizzes-only grades 8, 4 exams-DIFFICULT. You just have to study. Use the online hw to study, try to learn as u do it. BE NICE TO HER SHES SO SWEET
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Vogelien is an amazing professor. This is a genetics class so you have to STUDY. She has about 13 quizzes and only 9 best are counted. Final is not cumulative. She throws in extra credit. She is extremely sweet and caring. She would give you hours of time in office if you are not clear in any concept. SI sessions add to learning.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: She will talk thoroughly before lab and it can be long sometimes but pay attention, it'll help you. Her exams are not too hard. Very accessible and helpful when you have questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Graded on mastering genetics hw (only need about half the homework to get full credit), 13 quizzes (top 7 used), and 4 tests (test 4 is the final and not cumulative. She explains content well. She always nice and walks in and asks how youre doing, so answer her so its not weird.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She is very nice and very caring. Personally, the content was a little hard to grasp and her test questions were confusing. You can always ask her for help. She doesn't require attendance but I don't know how anyone could pass without listening to her speak. She goes way more in depth than the powerpoints. No extra credit :(
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: definitely the best professor to take genetics with at ksu. wish I took her for lecture. she understood that many people in her lab had already taken lecture and took the time to explain anything we may have forgotten. DO THE PRACTICE ONLINE TESTS. they are very similar to the lab tests and people overlook them since theyre only 5%. it helps
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Genetics is very difficult. She is so enthusiastic to teach though that it really makes you want to learn. She is extremely clear with what is expected and constantly reminds students of upcoming things. Gives extra credit, straightforward tests, take home quizzes, and mastering genetics. She has so many office hours. Made over a 100 in the class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I have Dr. Vogelien for lab and she's great. She's very kind and helpful and gives very clear pre lab lectures. If you need additional help she's always available for office hours. I definitely recommend.
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: I love Dr Vogelien!!!! Take her for any class she offers! She is a great professor and really cares about her student succeeding. Go to her office hours and get to know her. She is extremely sweet and helpful. One of my favorite professors of all time.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Took Dr. Vogelien for Genetics lab and I greatly regret not having her for lecture. It is really easy to get an A here. Show up to lab, take the lab activities seriously/ follow the instructions, and review the lab study objectives that she provides for every lab assessment. She is very helpful when answering questions.

Great professor, just a difficult course. She does what she can to help you understand, but with material like Genetics, its just something you have to sit down and understand yourself. She has leniency in her grading, giving partial credit if you can explain why you put down an answer in the exam, so she really is trying to give you credit.

Dr. Vogelien is really enthusiastic about genetics and wants her students to do well. She sometimes just seems to smart, but she tries to make things funny and relatable. Regardless, the class is hard, and often boring if you're not into it, and requires extra time. Homework is Mastering, 16 small quizzes, 8 of which actually count, and 4 exams.
Her class can be very hard, do to the amount of detail that you will need to know. She is always in her office if you have questions. The book and it's companion website are a life saver.

Dr Vogelien was great for genetics. This class is difficult but she makes it bearable. Take notes in class. I recorded each lecture and then went back and licensed to them later to get more detail. I got A's and B's on everything. This class took a lot of time. READ, do suggested problems, STUDY!

Go to class. She puts up powerpoints before class  but they aren't described too well. The tests are challenging and you need to keep up with the homework and reading. Class is a lot of work but interesting and she is willing to help. 19 online quizzes but she drops half and takes the best grades. She talks in circles and can get confusing.

So caring and knowledgable!! Very available for help throughout the week. Lectures are long and fast paced, does not include every slide on D2L or the audio anymore so its in your best interest to attend class! Online quizzes all semester but only counts 9. Definitely have to readstudy for tests, but Vogelien is clear on what is on them! Love her!

Genuinely wants you to do well. Cares immensely and is very  charismatic. She gives online quizzes all semester but only takes your highest 6. Her quizzes are a lot like her tests and she also gives you a detailed outline of what to expect on her tests. Lecture audio gets posted too for you as well as all of the lecture powerpoints.

Charismatic and clear during lectures, posts powerpoints ahead of time, outlines what she will go over & summarizes what she just went over. Posts audio of lectures, office hours extremely helpful. Quizzes (takes highest 6) good indicator of what she tests on. Tells you specifically the kind of questions that she will test you on. Genuinely cares

I would take her again. She posts audio recordings of the lectures on D2L. Her quizzes are extremely detailed and difficult, but are online. Go to lecture or listen to recordings and read the book (pretty short chapters) and you'll do fine. Replaces lowest test grade with final grade. She likes students that visit her office hours.

Probably the best professor in the biology department at KSU. Crystal clear expectations and will go out of her way to help you. Her tests cover only what she talks about in class. Very reasonable.  You can tell she really enjoys teaching.
She will go to the ends of the earth to help you understand and succeed. Not easy but you know what is expected

very helpful. cares about her students grades and will give as much help as she can if you ask. she expects you to know the material and teaches in a ways that would make it hard for you to forget. she posts recordings of the lectures on her website , which makes it easier to pass.

boring class for the most part, but lectures were easy. just copying notes from the board or powerpoints. she likes to interact with the class. she was very helpful and didnt mind questions. easy class, just do your work.
